items.title: BBC News app

items.title: What the NHS can learn from the European country that boosted cancer survival rates
items.summary: Denmark's survival rates record for certain cancers was low compared to other wealthy countries - then it came up with a bold plan

items.summary: State government to arrive at a decision on land acquisition for the project; the government intends to provide justice to the farmers, says H.K. Patil

items.summary: Nazeer lauds the institution’s achievements in global rankings, sustainability initiatives, and international research collaborations

items.summary: SHE teams of GVMC raid 302 food joints; 173 outlets found violating regulations and penality of ₹2.71 lakh imposed on erring managements

items.title: 144 Telugus stranded in Nepal return to A.P.
items.summary: Of the total, 104 people alights at Visakhaptnam airport; the flight continue its journey to Tirupati with the remaining 40 passengers

items.summary: The band reflect on their cult status and Oasis-esque reunion alongside Sirs Paul McCartney and Elton John.

items.summary: Tankers taking water for US billionaire Stephen Schwarzman have been told to stop by Southern Water.

items.title: Structures erected to greet Modi pulled down in Manipur’s Churachandpur

Trump and other US leaders tighten security as hunt for Charlie Kirk's killer continues
items.summary: Political figures across the US are adding security and canceling events, as universities receive threats.

items.title: The invisible children in Chengara’s protest land
items.summary: Around 200 children live in abominable conditions in Chengara, the site of a long-standing protest in Kerala, a State that takes pride in its child development indices. The settlement lacks electricity, piped water connections, and proper roads. K.S. Sudhi and Hiran Unnikrishnan chronicle the plight

items.title: Diarrhoea cases in Vijayawada go up to 102, no clarity yet on causes
items.summary: No deaths reported, says Minister; reports of water samples sent to Institute of Preventive Medicine awaited; control room set up at the Collectorate

items.summary: A woman inmate who was apprehended at Kishanganj along the Bihar border was handed over to the police

items.title: Poland vows to press ahead with ‘military modernisation’ after drone incursion
items.summary: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk pledges to forge ahead with plans to modernize the country’s military after Russian drones crossed into Poland

items.title: Exhibition on nuclear energy evokes good response
Supreme Court Collegium proposes Chief Justices to three High Courts
items.summary: The Collegium has recommended Justice Soumen Sen as Chief Justice of Meghalaya High Court; Patna HC Acting Chief Justice P.B. Bajanthri was recommended as its regular Chief Justice; Justice M. Sundar was recommended as the Chief Justice of Manipur High Court

items.title: Director of Fire Services calls for compliance reports in 30 days

items.summary: Turkish prosecutors seize Can Holding conglomerate, including major TV stations, arrest executives on fraud charges

items.title: Watch: France’s new PM Lecornu faces protests, debt crisis and political turmoil
items.summary: France has appointed Sebastien Lecornu as its new prime minister, replacing Francois Bayrou amid protests and economic turmoil. Lecornu takes charge during mass demonstrations against austerity, soaring national debt, and a fragmented parliament.

items.title: C.P. Radhakrishnan to take oath as the new Vice-President on September 12
items.summary: Mr. Radhakrishnan, according to sources, has also called a meeting of all floor leaders of Rajya Sabha

items.title: Israel intercepts missile fired from Yemen after deadly Sanaa strikes
items.summary: No one immediately claimed responsibility for the missile attack on Israel

items.title: Ayyankuzhi families vacate lodge, claim BPCL-KR has agreed to pay rent
items.summary: Oil company dismisses families’ claim, says no concrete commitments were given either in terms of rent or potential land acquisition

items.summary: BJP claimed that it had “undeniable” technical proof that power-point presentation made by Rahul Gandhi to allege vote theft had been created abroad

items.title: Samalapuram Town Panchayat president arrested on murder charge
Government contemplates raising civil border guards along China border
items.summary: Border Wing Home Guards, paid and treated as constables, are now active only in Rajasthan; used for information collection, dissemination during Operation Sindoor; may be used to support ITBP along China border

items.title: Bombay High Court rejects discharge plea of former Karvy CEO in ₹2,700-crore securities fraud case
items.summary: The prosecution alleges that KSBL illegally pledged and misused client securities worth about ₹2,700 crore without consent, in violation of SEBI circulars and the Code of Conduct for stockbrokers

items.summary: Yoane Wissa showed a "determination to succeed" after being a victim of an acid attack in 2021 - and that drive has been a constant factor in the career of Newcastle's new signing.

items.title:
Tracing the history of colonial powers
in Tamil land through charts, maps
items.summary: European sailors prepared maps and diagrams mainly for space and direction. But they have so far remained unused. Recently, 1,862 maps of forts, armouries, granaries, mints, and treasuries — selected from the Tamil Nadu State Archives — have been uploaded on Tamil Digital Library. They will be the i

items.title: The caste tensions that sparked after T.N. Scheduled Caste activist Immanuel Sekaran’s murder in 1957
items.summary: The events, starting with riots at Mudukulathur, continue to dominate the public discourse. While the Scheduled Castes were among the adversely impacted people, police firing at Keezhathooval, wherein five persons belonging to the Mukkulathors were killed, confounded the situation. Clarity is still

items.title: The hands behind the golu dolls of Bommaikara Theru in Kancheepuram
items.summary: Asthagiri street, known as Bommaikara Theru, in Kancheepuram was once filled with doll makers whose craft defined Navaratri. Today, only a handful of families remain, balancing tradition with changing demand and rising expenses.

items.title: Man from Rajasthan held for selling narcotics
Gang of five men held for land fraud
The anxious, ‘absent’ migrant voters of Gopalganj
items.summary: Gopalganj district has the highest number of names deleted from the draft electoral list, with voters declared ‘absent’ or ‘permanently shifted’, though many migrants still want to register as electors

items.title: Bhanumathi: a multi-faceted star of Tamil, Telugu cinema
items.summary: Bhanumathi was not just about acting. She directed and produced 16 films and wrote screenplays, dialogues, and scripts. She composed music. She sang all the songs in her films and included one keerthana of Thyagaraja mostly in her Telugu movies

items.title: Swades Foundation reshaping rural India through mindset change
items.summary: Guided by the motto, ‘Swa Se Bane Des’ or ‘I make my own country,’ the Foundation today works across over 1,300 villages across Maharashtra, building a model of empowerment that is sustainable, and community led

items.title: Three nabbed for stealing bikes in Triplicane and Royapettah
Roads in poor condition due to sewerage work at Pammal
items.summary: Several portions of Anna Salai in Pammal have been dug up and the earth dumped on the road, causing severe inconvenience to vehicle users. Residents say it is difficult to even walk on the road

items.title: TMC charges Union Minister and BJP leader with disrespecting Rabindranath Tagore’s photograph
items.summary: TMC highlighted a photograph of the poet which was allegedly placed at the feet of  Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar. The BJP leader said that the portrait of the poet was not placed on the stage but at a distance

items.title: Police diary with no specific acts cannot be ground to detain a person: Jammu and Kashmir High Court quashes PSA
items.summary: The advocates who appeared for the accused informed the court that the entire material forming the basis of the grounds of detention “was neither supplied nor explained to him in the language he understands”

items.title: 1500 houses to be built by High-Range Rural Development Society-India for victims during Operation Sindoor, floods in Jammu and Kashmir
items.summary: An official said the HRDS India will build 1500 free houses across the Union Territory

items.title: Madhya Pradesh High Court notice to government authorities over death of infants after rat bites at Indore hospital
items.summary: On August 30 and 31, the two girls were gnawed upon by rats inside the NICU of the MY Hospital, one of Madhya Pradesh’s largest government-run medical facility

items.title: Railway Minister announces parcel train to transport apples from Kashmir to Delhi
items.summary: The move comes as a relief to orchardists in south Kashmir, where hundreds of trucks laden with apple produce worth ₹200 crore are stranded due to the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu national highway for the past 13 days following landslips triggered by heavy rains

items.title: Jammu and Kashmir court declines narco test on two Pahalgam attack accused ‘without their consent’

items.title: China penalises popular app Xiaohongshu over content
items.summary: China’s regulator did not name other online forums in its statement but said it would “urge websites and platforms to fulfil their main responsibilities and social responsibilities” to keep a clear cyberspace

items.summary: Petitioner claims the fee charged by BCI was in violation of Section 24(1) (f) of Advocates Act, 1961 and infringed on the fundamental rights under Articles 19(1)(g) and 14 of Constitution

items.title: RPF seeks compensation from youths for allegedly throwing stones at train
